documents.document: @PoppetMo Thx. Wasn’t too upset by earlier loss of a few freshly hatched ducklings, but this one hurts a bit as the duckling was a month old
Agree. Without greater integration in schools and society, te reo Māori's status as an official language is in dang… https://t.co/5HZJUQBqcD
Thanks to @patrick_h_lauke for clearing this up: Yes, there is such a thing as too much Kiss in your timeline. https://t.co/XsDUyVfhqI
@patrick_h_lauke Is there such a thing as too much Kiss in your timeline?
@davekeyes Ha! Never heard of them, but wish I had.
When people on the phone aren’t sure how to spell my last name, I tell them it’s like their favourite 80s rock band, and then they get it.
Lost a duckling overnight :( Likely washed away in the stream that's raging now from all the rain yesterday and last night.
@thebillygregory @jonbmetz Well played!
Hmmm. 'Tis a wee bit moist out there this evening.
Yikes. Search results in @TeamIntergen's Cohesion ECMS seem effectively unusable with keyboard only. Hope I'm wrong about that. #A11y
It's confusing cuz Cohesion is built on MS SharePoint 2013, which itself is way more accessible out of the box. What did they do to it?
Guess I'll be asking our service desk to file and retrieve all my documents. That'll be efficient.
In a training session for @TeamIntergen's Cohesion ECMS for govt and wondering why so much of its functionality isn't keyboard accessible.
@thebillygregory @jonbmetz Try not to talk about PDF a11y. Just try. I dare you.
If you’re in San Diego on March 1st, sign up to attend the “role=drinks” accessibility meetup: https://t.co/FEk0P39oUX @roledrinks
@detonite Please do. Was just about to email, so thanks.
@detonite Sorry. I should have been clearer by writing “chocolate” with scare quotes.
@detonite There’s no requirement to eat the chocolate to get the egg, though, is there?
@aardrian You should have included some prunes.
Indicate the current item in a set of related elements with the aria-current attribute. @LeonieWatson tells you how: https://t.co/Z7Gzi09nst
@miss__haley @ewaccess @aardrian @sarahebourne @jalbertbowdenii I’ve seen enough Defs of Done that include a11y, but are just ignored.
@karlgroves @sarahebourne @aardrian @alastc @ewaccess Compared to security, that’s definitely the case here.
@sarahebourne Good point. And as @aardrian noted, there are community and cultural factors involved. @karlgroves @alastc @ewaccess
@alastc I think you’re right: there’s no malicious intent to swindle a client, and the client is often complicit.
@karlgroves @alastc @ewaccess There are also cultural issues at play. Direct business relations like that are too confrontational for some.
+1. I recommend exactly the same thing. https://t.co/YaOrmBya0f
@aardrian That’s certainly the case here. We have some internal channels where we’ll be able to share our experiences.
@karlgroves @alastc @ewaccess That’s what I’ve been telling all the business units I advise.
@alastc @ewaccess Bad planning and management, for sure, plus misrepresentation about their a11y expertise.
@blauerpunto You’re right. We definitely need to ramp up the tough love and start saying no to work that doesn’t meet the contract.
@aardrian I agree, and am frustrated how reticent govt agencies are, in my experience, to force those web firms to meet their obligations.
What do *you* call it when a web firm takes contract to develop to WCAG but then claims no time is left in the sprint to make it accessible?
Make your web emoji accessible with these tips from @LeonieWatson (https://t.co/HQvGYs7Jts) and @aardrian (https://t.co/c3iKhGZUfZ) #a11y
@SinaBahram @stommepoes Seems long ago now, for sure. Yep, see you at CSUN. Happy that it’s in California (and for my diplomatic visa).
@stommepoes I hear you! I occasionally checked in, but the world kept disabusing me of that.
Second day back at work after 5 weeks holiday avoiding the world. 5 weeks obviously not long enough. Nice to see colleagues again, tho.
@stommepoes It is, unless I take them away from mum :(
Three little ducklings! https://t.co/wNCbTmJiT6
Thanks @surkovalexander for a small flood of fixes & comments on the HTML-AAM today, and just in time for Christmas! https://t.co/5FVCXoL6Cl
@stommepoes Good recall, then ;)
@stommepoes that's what @MSEdgeDev say at https://t.co/xJSPfpkfhT
@stommepoes Those are useful animations. I wonder where the line is in terms of usefulness and least motion sickness?

@stommepoes What kind of user setting?
☑ Allow nauseating transitions?
@SteveBuell Nothing recently, but I’ve emailed you a link to some.
@SteveBuell Good idea! Me too. Sheep all good. Saved a lamb’s life last Saturday! It was just waiting to die after hours strangled by vines.
Remembered at 1am I had left hose running in lower paddock. Turns out jandals (aka flip flops) don't protect feet from sheep dung.
@SteveBuell Yes, indeed. All plans ready. See you there!
@SteveBuell I'm sure. Fresh curds help. Hope all is well.
@SteveBuell No side trip to Balderson for some curds, or Almonte for ice cream?
New outdoor hydrotherapy spa pool was delivered Tuesday. Getting set up today, just in time for Christmas! Bubbles, relaxation, stargazing.
Short email thread from @webaim on web transitions and motion sickness: https://t.co/Z76iWPDxSg #a11y
@MarcoInEnglish Have a great Christmas and holiday, Marco. Hope you and partner are over your flu soon.
Useful report for any govt considering #a11y: Monitoring methodologies for Web Accessibility in the European Union https://t.co/33c2JKDBdq
@karlgroves @detonite Have had my head in the sand lately. Is that research available somewhere?
Very neat tool to help people with reading: https://t.co/s9a7wM2Fp6 Also a great example of disconnect between such tools and web #a11y.
@stevefaulkner No way! Sweet as, mate.
@govtnz @mr_morphic Cool. Also looks like each data table is duplicated: one is offscreen, and one is in the accordion.
@govtnz @mr_morphic Nice work providing source data for the graphs. Many of the tables lack programmatic & visually distinct col headers.
@MichielBijl maybe, but only if it works as a MySpace plugin.
@CreetureNZ That’s a paddlin’. #blocked ;)
Anytime someone starts talking “innovation," I begin to suspect that they don’t have anything meaningful to say.
@cookiecrook Where did all the poop emoji in your twitter name go? (That was you with all the poop emoji, wasn’t it?)
@heydonworks You partially responsible for this, no? https://t.co/fe1NJFMMkq
@lightweight @CreetureNZ Don’t need design: The tools exist. I think the major hurdle is security concerns, and then, um, leadership.
@CreetureNZ @lightweight I know parts of .govt.nz who would pay that fee :)
@CreetureNZ Their numbers are low, it is true, but they can be found in the wild.
@CreetureNZ Aha! Yes. And a relatively brand new PSI exists, but it is mostly just information broadcast: no collab.
@DSelitskiy Amazingly, it appears to be so :(
Imagine if all NZ Govt agencies had one secure, accessible space where they could communicate, share and collaborate. #waitingForTheInternet
@mlascarides Good call. Would necessarily include seagull hair and a modicum of whining.
I AM NOT YOUR OBJECT NOTATION!
@AmeliasBrain :) That shot is from my deck. The cows seem unfazed. From all accounts, the one’s death was as quick and humane as possible.
Had 1 of our 3 cows slaughtered yesterday. Here are the remaining 2 (1 brown, 1 black) grazing the lower paddock ju… https://t.co/odziq760pD
@chaals You should see if you can get Wing to perform that one. @OZeWAI
Roughly 19 business days, 1 hour and 45 minutes of work remain before 5 weeks of holiday. #countingDown
Thanks @OZeWAI for the live streaming.
@blauerpunto @tanya For tweets, try @marcysutton and @sundress, and see who they play with. Also join A11y Slack: https://t.co/6LTJfCp4jh
@MarcoInEnglish Thanks. Luckily, I'm an hour north of Wellington, so wasn't as strong for us here. @stommepoes @MichielBijl
@stommepoes @MichielBijl Thanks you guys. It hit around midnight. Definitely woke me up, but all good.
@MichielBijl @stommepoes And you'd be welcome to them.
@MichielBijl @stommepoes There are dozens of them. Dozens!!
@AmeliasBrain @stommepoes they are :) In our case, 4 ducks lay white, and the 1 Buff Orpington blue.
@stommepoes Most everyone, it seems, which is good. We give away almost all of the eggs. https://t.co/oAu6rtzSp4
@Joanmarie There are lots of us North Americans here. And one isn't even forced to like Marmite.
@stommepoes 4 to 5 a day. And they're great. But I can't eat them: some kind of sensitivity :( Thought you knew. https://t.co/TpNw5uKtX2
Or a video of 6 ducks on a small wooden bridge over a stream, should that be more your fancy. https://t.co/RHOLuKlBRD
In case you need a vid of 5 variously black & white, roughly 3 month old lambs running about a hilly, green paddock. https://t.co/5YOSXWkW0k
October release of Adobe Reader DC for Mac fixes access to the document pane for #VoiceOver. Nice work @AdobeAccess. #a11y #pdf
@patrick_h_lauke No art therapy available.
@aardrian You’ll appreciate it when you start carrying around that 21” touchscreen.
@MichielBijl Could be. Of all those who just throw words around, and usually don’t even know what they mean, @FriendlyAshley is the worst.
@MichielBijl @FriendlyAshley Obviously wants something.
@MichielBijl I’ll be at Funka, but that’s the only Europe trip I’ve got planned. You better be at that one!! Missing that hug already.
@MichielBijl Just V&L’s show, or CSUN?!!?
@Narelle_NZ I get that :) For me, lunch at my desk is part of my plan to reduce the amount of time I spend in the office ;)
@Narelle_NZ Not sure how I‘d react to that. At NatLib, people who work with records and such obviously can’t eat at desks. But I can and do.
@Narelle_NZ What’s the argument for not allowing eating at your desks? Are you allowed beverages?
@SinaBahram Your B? Well, HB, then!
@jonbmetz @mgifford Now that @sarahebourne brought up the very pertinent but very painful aspect of legacy workflows, I’m wading out :)
@jonbmetz @mgifford …across multiple platforms, I think EPUB3 is in the lead.
